source.db35a1cb: unicorn['Valuation ($B)'] = unicorn['Valuation ($B)'].str.replace('$', '', regex=False).astype(float) #removing $ and casting to float
source.96a1f1c2: unicorn[unicorn['City'].isna()] #all missing cities are city-states, meaning they are the same as Country column
source.9b00af1e: unicorn['Select Investors'].fillna('Haitong Kaiyuan Investment, Northern Light Venture Capital', inplace=True)
source.b34f2040: unicorn[['Investor 1', 'Investor 2', 'Investor 3', 'Investor 4']] = unicorn['Select Investors'].str.split(', ', expand=True) #splitting into new columns
